title: Carbon-Neutral Product Labels Are Proliferating. Will They Pay Off?
sub_head: Companies are buying carbon offsets and pitching products as carbon neutral, but most shoppers donâ€™t know what the terms mean
body:
From wine to sneakers, more consumer products are sporting labels touting their carbon-neutral credentials. How the labels will pay off with consumers remains to be seen.
Climate Neutral, a nonprofit certification outfit for products pitched as carbon neutral, says it has given its seal of approval to 338 brands, some of which use it on labels or packaging, up from just four in 2019. The companies it endorsed include sneaker maker Allbirds Inc., Lubanzi Wines of South Africa and outdoor brand Recreational Equipment Inc., known as REI.
